description: '''Folk punk''' (originally known as '''rogue folk''') is a fusion of [[folk music]] and [[punk rock]]. It was popularized in the early 1980s by [[the Pogues]] in England, and by [[Violent Femmes]] in the United States. Folk punk achieved some mainstream success in that decade. In more recent years, its subgenres [[Celtic punk]] and [[gypsy punk]] have experienced some commercial success.
